alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 1:34PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Middle Thompson Creek, North Thompson Creek, Crystal River, East Divide Creek, Fourmile Creek, Cattle Creek, Threemile Creek, Baldy Creek, Roaring Fork River, Willow Creek, Garfield Creek, Freeman Creek, Calf Creek, West Fork Baldy Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
